unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Tossing Weighted Die
question_text: A $6$ -sided die is weighted so that not every number is equally likely to appear when the die is tossed. The table below shows the probability distribution. Result (X) 1 2 3 4 5 6 p(X) 0.12 0.14 0.08 0.27 0.25 0.14 Suppose the die is tossed and we are told that the result is a number greater than $4$ . Based on this information, what is the probability that the result was a $6$ ?
